divs: sighting detailsthis sighting took place in madison, connecticut. i was at a beach in madison in the late evening. i was sitting on the beach with a friend about twenty feet from the water. while we were talking i noticed what i thought was a shooting star several miles east of us and traveling from south to north. at that time i thought it was quite odd to see a shooting star as we were under fully overcast skies. i didn't give it any more thought since i was more interested in the girl i was with. several minutes later i noticed the tops of distant trees being luminated much like a cars headlights light up trees on a distant mountain. again i thought it was odd as there are no trees that tall in the direction i was looking. this still wasn't enough to distract me from the girl. though i did mention both occurances to her. several minutes later as we talked we both noticed it getting lighter where we were sitting. we looked around and didn't see anything unusual until we looked up. sitting at about 45 degrees above us and about 100 feet away was a glowing sphere about 3 feet in diameter. it was completely silent. it was slowly rotating and had a texture that looked very much like liquid crystal, the type used in lcd displays. for several minutes it didn't move at all. then it slowly started to follow the edge of the water coming toward us for several more minutes. it then instantly shot north just over the trees. it didn't appear to accelerate, it seemed to instantly be going at whatever speed it went leaving nothing more than a slight woosh sound. it was out of sight in less than one second. we sat back down and needless to say that was the subject of conversation for the next 20 minutes. we then noticed the same light around us and when we looked up, it was back in almost the same position. again it sat there for a minute and again started to follow the edge of the water. this time however, shortly after starting to move it very rapidly carved out a star shape, as you would draw a star on paper, but each leg was about 40 feet. on the last leg of the star it shot down into the water and crashed about 100 feet from where we were standing and only about 20 feet out in the water. the star pattern and the crash all happend in well under a second. it went out of site for about 30 seconds under water. i ran to the edge of the water adjacent to the object. it then popped back up and was floating on the surface. it was broken with about an 18 inch hole that was pointing toward me. it was still glowing and i could see some of the insides. it was a hollow sphere with about a 1\2 inch wall thickness. there was a bundle of what appeared to be fiber optic type cable hanging over the edge of the hole that were also glowing. that was everything i could see. i started to run into the water to grab it but about three steps into it i stopped, thinking that might not be a smart thing to do since i don't know what it is, and it's broken. the thought ran through my head "am i willing to die to have this thing?" the answer was no. i stood there for about 10 more minutes. it slowly started to dim and it finally sank right there. prior to this incident i never really gave ufo's much thought beyond entertainment value. but that was a convincer for me as it was for my friend. thanks for letting me share my experience. andy
